definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
to feel attached to/to long for/to love
a wooden or bamboo pen for sheep or cattle/wood or bamboo trestlework/a warehouse
lit. the old horse loves his stable/fig. sb old but reluctant to relinquish their post (idiom)
an incompetent man clings to a good position (idiom)
see 駑馬戀棧|驽马恋栈[nu2 ma3 lian4 zhan4]

sentences.english: Putin's problem is not staying in power.
sentences.chinese: 普京的問題是必要戀棧權力。

sentences.english: If fruit is affectionate, he will be loath to give up his natal place too.
sentences.chinese: 果實如若有情，也是戀棧的。

sentences.english: I only know there's, nothing here for me.
sentences.chinese: 我只是知道這裏，再也沒有可戀棧的東西。

definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to become a mere formality
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to admonish/instructions/orders
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
to die in battle (idiom)
to boss people around (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to take refuge in religious life
control
